author: atif4088
content:
Dear Community, Good afternoon,

- Running a merge network with custom `config.yaml` without pre-allocated validators(without `genesis.ssz` ). Network has been started with pow in geth and beacon `powchain` service has observed deposits from `eth2-deposit` contract's event logs.
- Network is currently running on bellatrix fork.
- Now i am trying to start a fresh node(prysm/lh beacon with geth) and try to sync with network but beacon can not sync with our network. 
- After investigating beacon logs, beacon has not created genesis state yet. And geth can sync to TTD block then it is waiting for beacon's switch over. 
- And beacon client is waiting for min genesis validators and min genesis time which has already passed few days ago in our network. But before TTD, we have deposited more than min genesis validator count. But unfortunately  new beacon can not observe those deposits.

author: fox_citizen
content: H everyone, is it true that Ethereum 2.0 with PoS will no reduce by any mean the gas fees requested per transaction after the merge because the changes introduced by the merge affects only the **Consensus Layer** and not the **Execution Layer**?

author: cheeky_gorilla
content: <@703595375675834401> It's true, the Bankless guys cover it very briefly here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pUA-HzIbWD0&t=3279s (54:39)

author: cheeky_gorilla
content: Something called "proto danksharding" will be the upgrade that dramatically reduces transaction fees for rollups, you can read more about that here: https://www.eip4844.com/#faq

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: This whole discord is dedicated for discussions among ethereum developers. The ACD channel and the interop channel are needed for coordinating between the core devs and are closed to other developers since the signal to noise ratio there became bad
